item.title: MCPWM
item.description:
MCPWM (Motor Control PWM) offers enhanced features beyond standard PWM blocks, including programmable fault sources with digital comparator inputs, leading-edge blanking, dead-time compensation modes, and extensive trigger output capabilities for ADC synchronization.

Supported Device Families

Family Representative Devices Key Features
PIC32MK PIC32MK MCJ/MCM/MCA families Full MCPWM with digital comparators, advanced fault handling
dsPIC33C (selected) 33CH, 33CK families with MCPWM High-speed MCPWM, multiple fault sources
dsPIC33A Latest 33A families Enhanced MCPWM with fine edge placement

Key Features

Configuration Parameters

Time Base and Alignment

Parameter Description Options
PWMx_ECAM_ITB PWM mode selection • Edge aligned

Dead Time Configuration

Parameter Description Options
DTC Dead Time Control mode • Disabled
DTH_xxx Dead-time high-side (per PWM) Time in seconds
DTL_xxx Dead-time low-side (per PWM) Time in seconds
DTCMPSEL Dead-time compensation select Comparator source for compensation mode

Fault Configuration

Parameter Description
FLTSRCx Fault source selection for each PWM generator:
FLTSRC1..12_DTCMP Digital comparator assignment for dead-time compensation per PWM
FaultMode Fault response mode:
FaultState Output state during fault: All Low, All High, High-Z, or custom

Leading-Edge Blanking (LEB)

Parameter Description
LEB_Enable Enable leading-edge blanking for fault inputs
LEB_Duration Blanking time after PWM edge transition (ignores fault during switching noise)
LEB_Trigger Trigger source: Rising edge PWMxH, Falling edge PWMxH, or PWMxL edges

Trigger Outputs

Parameter Description
TRIG1..3 Up to 3 trigger outputs per PWM generator for ADC/DAC synchronization
SEVTCMP Special event compare for primary ADC trigger
TriggerInterrupt Enable interrupt on trigger events

PWM-ADC Synchronization

Proper synchronization between PWM generation and ADC sampling is critical for motor control and power conversion applications. The MCPWM block provides multiple trigger outputs (TRIG1..3, SEVTCMP) to precisely coordinate ADC conversions with PWM waveform timing.

item.title: PWM
item.description:
The PWM block supports up to 4 complementary PWM channel pairs with independent duty cycle control, dead-time insertion, fault protection, and special event triggers for ADC synchronization.

Supported Device Families

Family Devices Features
dsPIC30F All dsPIC30F devices with PWM module Basic PWM, Dead-time A, Fault A
dsPIC33F All dsPIC33F devices with PWM module Basic PWM, Dead-time A, Fault A
dsPIC33E dsPIC33EP devices with standard PWM Enhanced PWM, Dead-time A/B, Fault A/B

Key Features

Configuration Parameters

PWM Reference

Parameter Description Values
PWM_REF PWM peripheral reference (visible only if multiple PWM modules available) 1, 2, or Duplicate Ports for PWM x

Basic Configuration

Parameter Description Default
InitialPeriod PWM period in seconds (max depends on prescaler and clock) 100e-6 (100 µs)
CAM Center Aligned Mode (on/off) off
IUE Immediate Update Enable (on/off) off
Channel Enabled PWM channels (Low side) [1 2 3 4]
ChannelHigh Enabled PWM channels (High side, if separate control) [1 2 3 4]

Dead Time Configuration

Parameter Description Range
DeadTimePrescaleA Dead-time duration for Prescaler A in seconds 0 to max (depends on clock)
DeadTimePrescaleB Dead-time duration for Prescaler B in seconds (dsPIC33E only) 0 to max (depends on clock)
DTPWMxa/i Select Prescaler A or B for each PWM channel (active/inactive side) Prescaler A / Prescaler B

Fault Protection

Parameter Description Options
FAULTA_FLATM Fault A mode • Fault cleared automatically
FaultA_PWMx_State PWM output state during Fault A • Disabled
PIN_FaultA Fault A input pin (for remappable devices) Pin selection popup

Special Event Trigger

Parameter Description
PxSECMP Special event trigger time in seconds (typically for ADC sampling point)
PxSECMPBlkInChk Enable block input for dynamic event trigger control (on/off)

PWM-ADC Synchronization

The standard PWM block provides a Special Event Trigger (PxSECMP / SEVTCMP) to synchronize ADC sampling with PWM generation. This is essential for accurate current and voltage sensing in motor control and power conversion applications.

item.title: PWM HighSpeed
item.description:
This block is designed for demanding motor control and power conversion applications requiring precise timing, independent channel control, and high switching frequencies.

Supported Device Families

Family Masksets Key Features
dsPIC33F (selected) DOS_00958_pwm_TLAH DOS_00958_pwm_TLAY
dsPIC33EP (GS) DOS_00958_pwm_TLAH DOS_00958_pwm_TLAY
dsPIC33C/CH/CK Various (WAC, WBH masksets) Full-featured high-speed PWM, independent time bases

Key Features

Output Modes

Mode Description Use Case
Complementary PWMxH and PWMxL are complementary with dead-time insertion Standard motor drive, half-bridge converters
Redundant PWMxH and PWMxL output identical signals Parallel drive, increased current capability
Push-Pull PWMxH and PWMxL alternate (no dead-time) Push-pull converters, full-bridge DC-DC
Independent PWMxH and PWMxL operate independently Dual independent loads, asymmetric control

Configuration Parameters

Panel 1: Basic Configuration

Parameter Description Options
pop1 PWM output mode 1=Complementary, 2=Redundant, 3=Push-Pull, 4=Independent
ITB Independent Time Base 0=Master period for all, 1=Independent period per PWM pair
MDCS Master Duty Cycle Select 0=Independent duty cycle, 1=Master duty cycle
CAM Center Aligned Mode 0=Edge-aligned, 1=Center-aligned
IUE Immediate Update Enable 0=Synchronized update, 1=Immediate update
DBL_UPDATE Double Update Mode Enable asymmetric center-aligned PWM (2 duty cycle values)
chkHL1 Output Enable Select which PWMxH and PWMxL outputs are enabled
maxP1 Maximum Period Array of maximum period values in seconds for each PWM

Panel 2: Period and Duty Cycle

Parameter Description
InitP2 Initial period values (seconds). Scalar for master, array for independent
chkP2 Enable period block inputs (0=constant, 1=variable via input port)
InitDC Initial duty cycle values (%). Can be [single] or [val1 val2] for double update
chkDC Enable duty cycle block inputs per channel

Panel 3: Dead Time Configuration

Parameter Description
DTH Dead-time for high-side transitions (seconds). One value per enabled PWM
DTL Dead-time for low-side transitions (seconds). One value per enabled PWM

Panel 4: Trigger Configuration

Parameter Description
TrigOut Trigger output configuration for ADC/DAC sync. Format: [PWM# TrigPoint]
TrigOutBlkIn Enable block input for dynamic trigger control

Block Inputs

Input Type Condition Description
Period uint16 or uint16[] chkP2 = 1 Period value(s). Scalar if ITB=0, vector if ITB=1
DutyCycle 1..N uint16 or uint16[2] chkDC = 1 Duty cycle values. Single value or [val1 val2] for double update
Trigger 1..N uint16 TrigOutBlkIn = 1 Dynamic trigger point values
DeadTimeH 1..N uint16 Optional Dynamic dead-time high (if enabled)
DeadTimeL 1..N uint16 Optional Dynamic dead-time low (if enabled)

Block Outputs

Output Type Description
Trigger 1..N boolean Trigger output signals (for custom synchronization logic)
PWM Status uint16 Optional status output (if enabled)

Clock Configuration

Auxiliary Clock (APLL) - dsPIC33EP GS Only

item.title: PWM HighSpeed Override
item.description:
The override block works in conjunction with the MCHP_PWM_HighSpeed block and can force PWM outputs to specific logic levels regardless of the PWM generator state. Important: Override control should be used with extreme caution in motor control applications, as improper use can cause hardware damage or create hazardous conditions. ## Supported Device Families This block supports the same device families as MCHP_PWM_HighSpeed: - dsPIC33F (selected) - with high-speed PWM module - dsPIC33EP (GS) - with auxiliary clock support - dsPIC33C/CH/CK - full-featured implementations

Key Features

  • Direct control of PWM output pins (PWMxH and PWMxL)
  • Individual or grouped override control
  • Override enable/disable per channel
  • Synchronization with PWM generator (optional)
  • Support for safe state configuration
  • Runtime override value modification

Configuration Parameters

Override Channel Selection

Parameter Description Values
OverrideChannels Select which PWM channels are controlled by override Vector of channel numbers [1 2 3 …]
OverrideMode Override application mode • Individual (per channel control)

Override State Configuration

Parameter Description Values
DefaultState_H Default state for high-side outputs when override active 0 (Low), 1 (High)
DefaultState_L Default state for low-side outputs when override active 0 (Low), 1 (High)
SyncMode Synchronization with PWM timebase • Immediate (override applied immediately)

Block Inputs

Individual Override Mode

Input Type Description
Override_En 1..N boolean Enable override for channel N (1=override active, 0=normal PWM)
Override_H 1..N boolean High-side output state when override enabled for channel N
Override_L 1..N boolean Low-side output state when override enabled for channel N

Grouped Override Mode

Input Type Description
Override_En boolean Enable override for all selected channels
Override_Value uint16 Bitfield: override state for all channels

Block Outputs

Output Type Description
Override_Status uint16 Current override register value (IOCONx.OVRDAT bits)
Override_Active boolean Indicates if any override is currently active

item.title: PWM HS FEP
item.description:
This advanced PWM peripheral is specifically designed for precision motor control, high-frequency power conversion, and applications demanding superior timing accuracy and reduced total harmonic distortion (THD).

Quick Reference

Application Key Settings Device Example
3-Phase Motor Control (HiRES) ClockResolution: "no scaling"
ECAM: "Center aligned - Symmetric"
Channels: [1 2 3]		 dsPIC33AK512MPS512
(14-bit resolution @ 50kHz)
Interleaved DC-DC Converter Channels: [1 2 3 4]
PhaseShift: [0, T/4, T/2, 3T/4]
ECAM: "Edge aligned"		 dsPIC33CK256MP508
(800kHz effective ripple)
Synchronized ADC Sampling SEVTCMP: 0 (valley trigger)
PWM→ADC→Task timing
Center aligned PWM		 Any dsPIC33A/C
(Noise-free current sensing)
EMI Spread Spectrum ECAM: "Asymmetric - double update"
Dynamic duty cycle modulation		 dsPIC33AK (V4)
(Harmonic spreading)

⚠️ Critical for HiRES Mode: Must use "no scaling" clock option - dividers/scalers disable High-Resolution mode!

item.title: PWM SAM7x
item.description:
| Family | Examples | Features | |—|—|—| | SAME5x | SAME54, SAME53, SAME51 | Up to 4 PWM channels, 120 MHz, TCC peripherals | | SAME7x | SAME70, SAMS70, SAMV71 | Up to 8 PWM channels, 300 MHz, advanced PWM features | | SAMC2x | SAMC21, SAMC20 | Up to 4 PWM channels, 48 MHz, motor control optimized | | SAMD2x | SAMD21, SAMD20 | Up to 3 PWM channels, 48 MHz, compact implementation |

Supported Device Families

  • SAM E70
  • SAM S70
  • SAM V70
  • SAM V71

Key Features

  • Complementary PWM output pairs with dead-time
  • Independent period and duty cycle control
  • Center-aligned and edge-aligned modes
  • Fault input with configurable response
  • Pattern generation for BLDC commutation
  • Synchronized PWM update
  • Dynamic dead-time adjustment

Configuration Parameters

Basic Configuration

Parameter Description
PWM_Channels Enabled PWM channel numbers (e.g., [0 1 2 3])
PWM_Mode Edge-aligned or Center-aligned
Period PWM period (constant or input)
DutyCycle_Init Initial duty cycle values

Dead Time

Parameter Description
DeadTime_Enable Enable dead-time insertion
DeadTimeH Dead-time for high-side output (seconds)
DeadTimeL Dead-time for low-side output (seconds)

Block Inputs/Outputs

Inputs

Input Type Description
Period Variable Optional period input (if enabled)
DutyCycle 0..N Variable Duty cycle per enabled channel
DeadTimeH 0..N uint16 Dynamic high-side dead-time (if enabled)
DeadTimeL 0..N uint16 Dynamic low-side dead-time (if enabled)

Outputs

Output Type Description
Fault_Status boolean Fault condition indicator (if fault enabled)

Usage Example

% SAME70 3-phase motor control:
PWM_Channels = [0 1 2];
PWM_Mode = 'Center-aligned';
Period = 1/20e3;  % 20 kHz

% Dead-time:
DeadTime_Enable = 'on';
DeadTimeH = [1e-6 1e-6 1e-6];  % 1 µs each phase
DeadTimeL = [1e-6 1e-6 1e-6];

% Connect duty cycle inputs from FOC algorithm

Related Blocks

  • MCHP_PWM_SAM7x_Override - Override control for SAM7x PWM
  • MCHP_TCC_PWM - TCC-based PWM for SAME5x/SAMC2x
  • MCHP_ADC_SAM - SAM ADC with PWM synchronization

item.title: PWM SAM7x Override
item.description:
All SAM7x families: SAME5x, SAME7x, SAMC2x, SAMD2x

Supported Device Families

  • SAM E70
  • SAM S70
  • SAM V70
  • SAM V71

Configuration Parameters

Parameter Description
Override_Channels PWM channels to control via override
Override_Mode Individual or Grouped control
Safe_State_H Safe state for high-side outputs (0=Low, 1=High)
Safe_State_L Safe state for low-side outputs (0=Low, 1=High)

Block Inputs

Input Type Description
Override_Enable boolean Activate override control (1=override active)
Override_Value uint16 Output pin states (bitfield)

Usage Example

% Emergency shutdown for SAM7x motor drive:
Override_Channels = [0 1 2];
Override_Mode = 'Grouped';
Safe_State_H = 0;  % All high-sides OFF
Safe_State_L = 0;  % All low-sides OFF

% Connect emergency stop -> Override_Enable

Related Blocks

item.title: TCC PWM
item.description:
| Family | TCC Instances | Channels per TCC | |—|—|—| | SAME54/53/51 | TCC0, TCC1, TCC2 | 6, 4, 3 channels | | SAMC21/20 | TCC0, TCC1, TCC2 | 4, 4, 2 channels | | SAMD21/20 | TCC0, TCC1, TCC2 | 4, 2, 2 channels |

Supported Device Families

  • SAM E5x
  • SAM D5x
  • SAM C2x

Key Features

  • Up to 6 PWM channels per TCC instance (device dependent)
  • Complementary outputs with dead-time
  • Circular, dual-slope (center-aligned) modes
  • Pattern generation for BLDC/stepper motors
  • Recoverable and non-recoverable faults
  • Dithering for enhanced resolution
  • Compare capture for position sensing

Configuration Parameters

Basic Configuration

Parameter Description
TCC_Instance Select TCC0, TCC1, or TCC2
Waveform_Mode Normal Frequency, Match Frequency, or PWM
Counter_Mode Up, Down, or Dual-slope (center-aligned)
Enabled_Channels Array of enabled channel numbers

Dead Time and Pattern

Parameter Description
DeadTime_Enable Enable complementary output with dead-time
DeadTime_Low Dead-time for low-side (cycles)
DeadTime_High Dead-time for high-side (cycles)
Pattern_Enable Enable pattern generator for BLDC
Pattern_Table Commutation pattern table

Block Inputs/Outputs

Inputs

Input Description
Period Optional period input
Compare 0..N Compare values (duty cycle) per channel
Pattern_Index Pattern table index (if pattern mode enabled)

Outputs

Output Description
Fault_Status Fault condition status
Overflow_Flag Counter overflow indicator

Usage Example

% BLDC motor control with TCC pattern generator:
TCC_Instance = 'TCC0';
Waveform_Mode = 'PWM';
Counter_Mode = 'Dual-slope';
Enabled_Channels = [0 1 2];

% Pattern generator:
Pattern_Enable = 'on';
Pattern_Table = [
    % Hall state -> [Ch0 Ch1 Ch2] outputs
    0b000000;  % Invalid
    0b100001;  % Hall 001
    0b001100;  % Hall 010
    0b101100;  % Hall 011
    0b110010;  % Hall 100
    0b110001;  % Hall 101
    0b011010;  % Hall 110
    0b000000   % Invalid
];

% Connect Hall sensor state -> Pattern_Index

Related Blocks

  • MCHP_PWM_SAM7x - General SAM7x PWM
  • MCHP_TC_PWM - Basic Timer/Counter PWM
  • MCHP_ADC_SAM - SAM ADC with TCC event sync
